title: Allow parallel_apply to take in list[Tensor]
body_html: This has no harm, but makes using parallel_apply nicer, and also avoids accidental slicing of Tensor if one accidentally pass in [tensor0, tensor1] as input instead of [[tensor0], [tensor1]]. It is actually particularly easy to make this mistake because [tensor0, tensor1] is the result of scatter(a_single_tensor_arg), e.g. #6983 .

It is actually particularly easy to make this mistake because [tensor0, tensor1] is the result of scatter(a_single_tensor_arg), e.g. #6983 .
body: This has no harm, but makes using `parallel_apply` nicer, and also avoids accidental slicing of Tensor if one accidentally pass in `[tensor0, tensor1]` as `input` instead of `[[tensor0], [tensor1]]`. It is actually particularly easy to make this mistake because `[tensor0, tensor1]` is the result of `scatter(a_single_tensor_arg)`, e.g. #6983 .
